ddabcd 1.0.1
  • Reference

    Example Wide-Form Data in Format of ABCD Study

    ddabcd_data_example_wide.Rd

    An example data set with simulated indifference scores for 48 participants over two time points formatted in the same style as data from the the ABCD study. Values were simulated from Rachlin's (2006) model with data following a logit-normal distribution. The generating log discounting rate and sensitivity parameters were specified to be weakly correlated with biological sex.

    ddabcd_data_example_wide

    Format

    ddabcd_data_example_wide

    A data frame with 96 rows and 15 columns:

    src_subject_id

    Participant ID

    eventname

    Study time point

    age

    Participant age in months

    sex

    Biological sex at birth for participant

    ddis_scr_val_indif_pnt_1da

    Indifference score for delay of 1 day

    ddis_scr_val_indif_pnt_1week

    Indifference score for delay of 1 day

    ddis_scr_val_indif_pnt_1mth

    Indifference score for delay of 1 month

    ddis_scr_val_indif_pnt_3mth

    Indifference score for delay of 3 months

    ddis_scr_val_indif_pnt_1yr

    Indifference score for delay of 1 year

    ddis_scr_val_indif_pnt_5yr

    Indifference score for delay of 5 years

    ddis_scr_val_immedcho

    Count of times participant picked rational immediate choice for 3 validity check questions

    ddabcd_simulation_lnk

    The generating parameter value for the participant (log discounting rate)

    ddabcd_simulation_s

    The generating parameter value for the participant (sensitivity)

    ddabcd_simulation_lnd

    The generating parameter value for the participant (log standard deviation for logit-normal distribution)
